newsitem.title: JORDAN: Israel's tourism minister to visit Jordan.
newsitem.headline: Israel's tourism minister to visit Jordan.

text.p: Israel's Tourism Minister Moshe Katsav will visit Jordan on Monday to discuss ways to boost cooperation and lure more tourists to the region, officials said on Friday.

Tens of thousands of Israelis have visited Jordan since it signed a peace treaty with Israel in October 1994, ending a 46-year-state of war between the two neighbours and encouraging them to market their countries' ancient riches on package tours worldwide.
Tourism has shown the most visible gains from the treaty in Israel and Jordan with more European and American guests visiting the region.

But it has suffered recently from uncertainty of future Middle East peace moves after the election of Israel's new hardline Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in May and U.S. air strikes against Iraq earlier this month.
